decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Kelsien, the Plague's ability to deal damage to target creature or planeswalker as a way to control the board and remove threats efficiently. This aggressive strategy is supported by a mix of removal spells, equipment, and creatures with powerful abilities. The deck aims to maintain board presence through aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Queen Marchesa, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben while also disrupting opponents' game plans with cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Kitesail Freebooter. By combining efficient removal, powerful creatures, and a strong mana base, the deck seeks to pressure opponents and come out ahead in one-on-one matchups.

This deck revolves around a fast and aggressive playstyle, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. It is focused on utilizing a wide range of burn spells, efficient creatures, and direct damage effects to control the board and pressure the opponent. Kari Zev, Skyship Raider serves as the commander and provides a quick and evasive threat. The deck includes a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Searing Blaze, and Flame Javelin to clear the way and deal direct damage. Aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear help apply pressure early on, while cards like Sulfuric Vortex and Seal of Fire provide a consistent source of damage over time.

The deck revolves around controlling the board by utilizing enchantments to disrupt opponents and protect your own resources. It focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Exploration, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth, while also generating card advantage with Enchantress effects like Argothian Enchantress and Eidolon of Blossoms. The key strategy is to establish a lock on the game with cards like Stony Silence and Suppression Field, while powering out threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sigil of the Empty Throne to close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through a combination of efficient removal, stax pieces, and card draw engines, ultimately grinding out wins through incremental advantage.
